newsitem.title: USA: Lehman says Q4 results reflect balance.
newsitem.headline: Lehman says Q4 results reflect balance.

text.p: Lehman Brothers Holdings Inc said record operating profit for the fourth quarter "reflected balanced strength" in all of its global businesses, including fixed income, equity and investment banking.
It posted operating income of $177 million, before a non-recurring severance charge of $50 million after taxes, versus $80 million a year ago.
"The fourth quarter was an excellent one for Lehman Brothers, by far the best we've had since the firm went public in 1994," said Richard Fuld, chairman and chief executive.
Lehman said net revenues after interest expense totalled $1.1 billion in the fourth quarter, up from $755 million.
"During the 1996 quarter, equity and debt underwriting and trading, foreign exchange, high yield, emering market, and M&A advisory showed particular strength," it said in a statement.

It said that during the fourth quarter, it exited or scaled back certain businesses. It left the precious metals business in the U.S., Europe, and Asia; consolidated Asian fixed income risk management activities into one center in Tokyo; "refocused" foreign exchange trading activities; and combined its Private Client Services offices in New York.
